title: Virtual Education Model Development for Designing Inclusive Science Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Focused on designing inclusive virtual learning environments for diverse learners, including integrating accessibility elements for students with visual/hearing impairments to strengthen science career education

learning_goals: Learners can identify at least three accessibility elements considering various disability types (visual, auditory, motor) when designing virtual environments
Learners can design and apply at least two multi-channel (text/audio/visual feedback) communication strategies for inclusive interactions in Zoom-based real-time classes
Learners can submit project outcomes demonstrating science experiment simulations implemented in a BYOD environment, incorporating alternative activities tailored to different types of disabilities.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
